A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
The good:
- Brilliant visuals - puts the prequels to shame. 
- Excellent sound/music (or lack of it during the hyperspace into snoke's ship moment)
- Great fight scene in the throne room. 

The bad:
- Plot holes galore. Not going to go into details\, just watch any review on youtube. 
- Leia's superman moment in space was pure stupidity. 
- The whole casino/code breaker subplot with Fin and Rose was pointless and only made the movie 30 minutes longer for no good reason. 
- Rey's character is a Mary Sue. Not relatable at all. 
- Luke's death was stupid and made no sense. 
- Character development non-existent.  Especially with Kylo's character. Why did he kill his dad and is so evil?  I'm not looking for Brothers Karamazov level of analysis\, just something that makes a little bit of sense. 
- Almost every scene on Luke's island was pointless and stupid\, from milking an alien's nipples\, to pole vault fishing to oversized frog nuns. 
- Snoke's death felt cheap and rushed.
- What they did with Luke's character was shameful.  Turned him into a grumpy hermit loser. 
- Yoda's scene didn't add anything beyond...nope\, I got nothing. 
There's plenty more but who has the time. Others have said it better. 

Worst Star Wars film of the franchise.
